ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a great compliment to other courses within African American studies and it unique in that it provides an international perspective.

A solid, interesting seminar. I don't think Adom will teach at Yale again, but this was an interesting syllabus and was well-taught. Not too much work, fairly engaging conversations, and interesting and unique readings.
General overview of Race and imperialism regarding the 20Th century, not necessarily the closing of imperialism however.

One of my favorite courses I've taken! Fascinating material, with a really well put together syllabus, and more importantly, a wonderful instructor. Adom is incredibly smart and engaging, an excellent seminar leader who is also extremely approachable and spends a lot of time giving feedback and guidance on students' work. Would highly recommend taking a class with her if you can!!!
